column3: I don't want to live beyond the age of 75. That would be a good point to bow out. I don't want to go on for ever.

Architecture is always the will of the age conceived as space - nothing else. Until this simple truth is clearly recognized, the struggle over the foundation of a new architecture confident in its aims and powerful in its impact cannot be realized; until then, it is destined to remain a chaos of uncoordinated forces.
It must be understood that every architecture is bound to its time and manifests itself only in vital tasks and through the materials of its age. It has never been otherwise.

In the 1940s, traveling for an African was a complicated process. All Africans over the age of sixteen were compelled to carry 'Native passes' issued by the Native Affairs Department and were required to show that pass to any white policeman, civil servant, or employer. Failure to do so could mean arrest, trial, a jail sentence or fine.

But there is a universality to story that isn't just limited to science fiction.

Better pass boldly into that other world, in the full glory of some passion, than fade and wither dismally with age.
Old age is ready to undertake tasks that youth shirked because they would take too long.

I'm going to do my best to do both and die of an ulcer at age 30.
